title: Given x(t), find accel. at a point

content.question: The position of a particle moving along the x-axis is <math> <semantics> <mrow> <mi>x</mi> <mrow> <mo>(</mo> <mi>t</mi> <mo>)</mo> </mrow> <mo>=</mo> <mi>sin</mi> <mrow> <mo>(</mo> <mrow> <mn>2</mn> <mi>t</mi> </mrow> <mo>)</mo> </mrow> <mo>−</mo> <mi>cos</mi> <mrow> <mo>(</mo> <mrow> <mn>3</mn> <mi>t</mi> </mrow> <mo>)</mo> </mrow> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@@4B13@</annotation> </semantics> </math> for time t≥0. When t=π, the acceleration of the particle is

topic.text: 4.2: Straight-Line Motion - Connecting Position, Velocity, and Acceleration

skill.text: Skill 1.E: Apply appropriate mathematical rules or procedures, with and without technology.
